title: Cleveland Browns have interest in hiring Bill Belichick, says NFL insider
description: The Browns reportedly have interest in Bill Belichick.
fullText:
Cleveland Browns have interest in hiring Bill Belichick, says NFL insider originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Should the Cleveland Browns lose their remaining three games, it will mark the second consecutive season in which they finished 3-14, meaning head coach Kevin Stefanski could certainly be on his way out.

Should the Browns decide to fire the two-time Coach of the Year, there are several names they could explore to make their next head coach. Brian Flores, Jesse Minter, and Chris Shula are all names to keep an eye on around the NFL. However, NFL insider Josina Anderson reports that there are multiple people in the Browns organization that would be interested in bringing in Bill Belichick.

"I'm told there's been recent interest expressed, at the very least, in speaking with Bill Belichick on a exploratory basis from two teams , per league source," Anderson reports on X. "My understanding is Belichick has upper-level personnel still fond of him in Atlanta, New York, Cleveland, whilst all struggling teams going through customary evaluations this time of year."

Belichick was the head coach of the Browns from 1991-95 before he was fired and the team moved to Baltimore. He then went to New England to join his former boss, Bill Parcells, as the Patriots' assistant head coach and defensive backs coach before leaving with Parcells and going to the New York Jets from 1997-99. When Parcells stepped down as head coach, Belichick was named the new head coach before infamously resigning and going back to New England, going on to win six Super Bowls. He is currently the head coach at the University of North Carolina.

title: Patrick Mahomes Already Rehabbing Knee 2 Days After Surgery ‚Äî Will He Recover in Time for Next Season?
description: Mahomes had surgery on Monday to repair two torn ligaments in his left knee
fullText:
Kansas City Chiefs officials said Patrick Mahomes is already starting rehab on his knee

The quarterback underwent surgery two days earlier to repair his ACL and LCL

Mahomes tore two ligaments in his left knee on the final drive of the Chiefs' playoff-eliminating loss Sunday

Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes has already begun rehabbing his left knee after undergoing surgery to repair the two torn ligaments he suffered in Sunday‚Äôs loss to the Los Angeles Chargers.

Team officials shared Mahomes' rehab news on Wednesday, Dec. 17, roughly 48 hours after the 30-year-old NFL star had the procedure done in Dallas.

Mahomes tore two ligaments ‚Äî his ACL and his LCL ‚Äî on a play late in the game, while the Chiefs were attempting to score on their final drive and save their season. After Mahomes was helped off the field, Kansas City failed to score and was mathematically eliminated from the NFL Playoffs for the first time in more than a decade.

The Chiefs' vice president of sports medicine and performance, Rick Burkholder, told reporters on Wednesday that the ‚Äúballpark‚Äù estimation for Mahomes‚Äô recovery window is roughly ‚Äúnine months,‚Äù meaning the three-time Super Bowl MVP is aiming to return for Week 1 of the 2026 NFL season.

"Every player is different. Every sport is different. Every position is different," Burkholder said, according to ESPN, adding that Mahomes ‚Äúis so in tune to what he does, he does it a little quicker.‚Äù

‚ÄúBallpark on this is nine months, but it could be a month or two more, a month or two less,‚Äù Burkholder added.

The 2026 NFL season is expected to kick off the week of Sept. 10, according to ESPN.

Burkholder told reporters he expects Mahomes will be extremely focused on his rehab in the coming months: ‚ÄúI think you guys know, as a player, his mindset is a little different than most," the Chiefs medical official said.

"He's so regimented in what he does,‚Äù Burkholder added. ‚ÄúHe's in here at 6 a.m. He's the last guy out at night. He'll take the rehab like that. When you add up all the little things, that allows the player to get back faster. They don't heal up faster, they just get back to performance faster."

Chiefs head coach Andy Reid also told reporters Wednesday that Mahomes seems ‚Äúso positive‚Äù after Monday‚Äôs surgery.

‚ÄúHe attacked this thing the day of,‚Äù Mahomes‚Äô longtime coach said. ‚ÄúYou wouldn't expect anything less. 'Get me up, get me going,' he's basically saying, an hour after the game. 'Brace me up and let me go.' It's not one of those injuries, obviously, but that's his mindset. I think he'll do great with the rehab. He's a pretty fast healer that way. And his attitude is 90% of things, how you go about it. How you're willing to push through the pain to get right."

Reid told reporters Monday that Mahomes was "in a good place" following the season-ending injury, but said the two-time NFL MVP "feels like he let people down.‚Äù

Mahomes has not spoken with reporters since the injury, but shared a message on social media underscoring his determination to get healthy and back on the field to start next season.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know why this had to happen. And not going to lie, it hurts,‚Äù Mahomes posted. ‚ÄúBut all we can do now is trust in God and attack every single day over and over again.‚Äù

Mahomes added: ‚ÄúThank you, Chiefs kingdom, for always supporting me and for everyone who has reached out and sent prayers. I will be back stronger than ever ‚è∞.‚Äù

title: Why Ole Miss‚Äô run defense could be a concern in the College Football Playoff
description: After a whole month of controversy with former head coach Lane Kiffin, the Ole Miss Rebels are finally back on the playing field, hoping to continue the best season in program history. They face a familiar matchup this weekend against a Tulane team that they blew out 45-10 earlier this year, and should cruise through [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
After a whole month of controversy with former head coach Lane Kiffin, the Ole Miss Rebels are finally back on the playing field, hoping to continue the best season in program history.

They face a familiar matchup this weekend against a Tulane team that they blew out 45-10 earlier this year, and should cruise through their first round College Football Playoff game on Saturday.

They‚Äôre a significant favorite and deservedly so. They outgained the Green Wave by nearly 250 yards in the first matchup, while completely shutting down their passing attack. Offensively, Trinidad Chambliss and Co. were dominant, throwing for over 300 yards while getting 241 more on the ground.

Ole Miss scored on eight of its first nine possessions, and Tulane just had no answers defensively. But, the blowout win did show a glaring concern: Ole Miss‚Äôs run defense.

The Rebels could not contain the Tulane ground game, as the Green Wave went for 178 yards on 4.6 yards per carry. And that wasn‚Äôt a one-game problem.

After being a dominant force up front in 2024, ranking first in rushing yards allowed per game (85.1) and in yards allowed per carry (2.4), Ole Miss has significantly slipped this season. They rank 71st in rushing yards allowed per game (157.1), while being 92nd in yards allowed per carry (4.7).

Now, the issue hasn‚Äôt shown up as much this year because Ole Miss‚Äôs offense has been elite, and the pass defense has been a top-30 unit in the country this year.

But, in Ole Miss‚Äôs close games this season, they struggled to defend the run. Against Kentucky early in the year, they allowed 172 rushing yards and 4.6 yards per carry. Arkansas went for 221 yards and four scores on six yards per carry in Ole Miss‚Äôs 41-35 win. Washington State had 127 yards on 4.5 yards a carry. Oklahoma went for 136 yards and two scores on nearly five yards a carry.

Then, there‚Äôs Georgia, who went for 221 yards and a touchdown on the ground in Ole Miss‚Äôs lone loss of the year. And that‚Äôs who the Rebels will play in the second round of the Playoff, assuming they beat Tulane.

Now, the Rebels are still a stellar 11-1 in the SEC. They‚Äôve managed to win behind that elite defense and good pass defense. And they should run through Tulane this weekend, whose defense can‚Äôt keep up with Ole Miss.

But, if there‚Äôs a reason why Ole Miss‚Äôs magical season might end earlier than fans hope, it‚Äôs the run defense, which can certainly be a prevalent issue against the top teams in the country.

title: Netflix Taps ESPN‚Äôs Elle Duncan as First Sports Anchor in Multiyear Deal
description: The former "SportsCenter" anchor will start her diverse range of coverage on Netflix in early 2026 with "Skyscraper Live"
fullText:
Netflix has signed ESPN‚Äôs Elle Duncan as its first sports anchor. As part of her multiyear deal, she will lead on-air coverage for Netflix Sports across the streamer‚Äôs diverse portfolio of growing sports coverage.

Her first on-air hosting gig will be in early 2026 with ‚ÄúSkyscraper Live,‚Äù where free solo climber Alex Honnold will attempt to scale Taipei 101, the tallest building in Taiwan.

‚ÄúJoining Netflix feels like being invited to an already legendary party and somehow getting handed the aux cord!‚Äù Duncan said. ‚ÄúFor a lifelong utility player, a multisport assignment is a full-circle moment, and being trusted with something this one-of-a-kind feels incredibly special and surreal. I‚Äôm bringing boundless energy, storytelling and bad puns no one asked for but will be subjected to anyway.‚Äù

‚ÄúAlso, I was told this fast-tracks my kids to meeting the KPop Demon Hunters, so ‚Ä¶ win-win,‚Äù she added.

Duncan comes from ESPN, known for her work on ‚ÄúSportsCenter,‚Äù ‚ÄúCollege GameDay‚Äù and ‚ÄúWNBA Countdown.‚Äù She specifically covered college and professional basketball, hosting ‚ÄúCollege GameDay‚Äù for women‚Äôs basketball across the country.

Netflix has expanded its sports portfolio signing deals with the NFL, MLB, the Women‚Äôs World Cup, WWE, FIFA and more, so Duncan‚Äôs coverage slate will be diverse.

‚ÄúElle Duncan‚Äôs proven ability to seamlessly move between hard-hitting sports analysis and warm, personality-driven cultural hosting makes her a perfect fit at Netflix,‚Äù Gabe Spitzer, vice president of sports at Netflix, said. ‚ÄúShe immediately adds credibility and familiar star power to our global programming slate.‚Äù

The television host started her career in Atlanta, as an anchor for NESN and spending six years as an Atlanta Hawks sideline reporter. She joined ESPN in 2016, where she hosted the 6 p.m. ET edition of ‚ÄúSportsCenter‚Äù and held key roles across college and professional basketball. Her final ‚ÄúSportsCenter‚Äù appearance was Tuesday.

The post Netflix Taps ESPN‚Äôs Elle Duncan as First Sports Anchor in Multiyear Deal appeared first on TheWrap.

title: Bayern Munich News: FC Bayern had multiple meetings with Marc Gu√©hi‚Äôs reps; Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester United eyeing Said El Mala; Robert Lewandowski‚Äôs next stop?; and MORE!
description: FC Bayern could make a move for Marc Gu√©hi‚Ä¶
fullText:
Bayern Munich is apparently very serious about acquiring Crystal Palace center-back Marc Gu√©hi:

Bayern held two meetings with the representatives of Marc Gu√©hi. The Englishman is a target for Bayern, but much will depend on what will happen with Dayot Upamecano. If the latter extends his contract, then Gu√©hi could look for a different solution. If Upa decides to leave, the Englishman would be a serious name for the club. At the moment, there are 4 clubs realistically in the conversation for Gu√©hi: Bayern, Liverpool, Real Madrid and Barcelona.

Madrid Universal captured more of Romano‚Äôs report, which details all of the elite clubs angling for the Crystal Palace defender:

Real Madrid are very much in the race for the 25-year-old Crystal Palace captain, but face stiff competition from arch-rivals Barcelona, who have already made a call to the player‚Äôs camp asking for information.

Moreover, Bayern Munich are also very much in the hunt and have already held two meetings with Guehi‚Äôs entourage to explore the possibility of a summer transfer. However, any move might depend on the future of Dayot Upamecano, with the Bayern Munich defender, another target for Real Madrid, still in negotiations over a contract renewal.

Finally, Premier League champions Liverpool are also in the race to sign Guehi, having missed out on his capture late last summer. Recent reports from England have suggested that even Manchester City are considering a move for the former Chelsea prospect.

As reported, Bayern Munich‚Äôs entire focus on Gu√©hi could shift if Upamecano re-ups. However, there will also be a big possibility that Kim Min-jae will want to leave Bavaria next summer. If so, Bayern Munich could go deeper into its pursuit of Gu√©hi or begin looking more closely at Borussia Dortmund‚Äôs Nico Schlotterbeck as well.

FC K√∂ln youngster Said El Mala is on Bayern Munich‚Äôs radar, but Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United could be an impediment to the 19-year-old moving to Bavaria:

The 19-year-old appears set to remain in the Bundesliga for the duration of the season, but the two Premier League outfits are prepared to start discussing a summer transfer. Both English clubs are interested in a purchase in the ‚Ç¨30m to ‚Ç¨40m range.

If you are so inclined, this might be of interest to you:

FC Barcelona could be eyeing Inter Milan center-back Alessandro Bastoni:

Barcelona have made an enquiry regarding Internazionale center back Alessandro Bastoni, according to Matteo Moretto. It is reported that Barca‚Äôs sporting director Deco recently travelled to Milan to discuss a potential move for the 26-year old, with the Blaugrana keen to sign the Italy defender due to uncertainty over the situation of Ronald Ara√∫jo, who is currently taking a mental health break. A January deal is expected to be difficult to secure, but the LaLiga side are exploring alternatives, with Aston Villa defender Pau Torres also on their shortlist, according to ESPN sources.

Bastoni had been linked to Bayern Munich in the past, but has not been mentioned to be on the club‚Äôs radar for quite a while.

On Wednesday, we saw that Inter Miami might have interest in FC Barcelona striker and former Bayern Munich star Robert Lewandowski, but for that to happen, Lionel Messi will have to outmaneuver the Chicago Fire, who hold Lewandowski‚Äôs discovery rights:

The Chicago Fire have held talks with Barcelona‚Äôs 39-year-old striker Robert Lewandowski over a move to MLS, says the BBC. Lewandowski is out of contract in the summer and has shown a desire to play in America before he retires.

Borussia Dortmund looks to be close to re-upping both Emre Can and Julian Brandt:

title: Against Anthony Joshua, Jake Paul finds himself on the other side of the extreme
description: Not sure if this is the most courageous act Paul has done, or the most foolish, but the answer is yes. It‚Äôs all those things.
fullText:
Honestly, you‚Äôd expect there to be a little more buzz for Friday night, given the set up.

Jake Paul, who has feasted on a steady diet of off-center beatables for the length of his boxing career, is facing off with the kind of fighter everyone has been demanding he face since he began. Anthony Joshua is 6-foot-6. He hits like a heavyweight because that‚Äôs what he is. He weighs 250 pounds. If you saw his destruction of Francis Ngannou, you know he‚Äôs the kind of boxer who cleanses people of their delusions. He‚Äôs elite by boxing‚Äôs standards, not on the freakshow curve Jake Paul is used to. There isn‚Äôt any kind of wink or nudge in play with AJ, and when he says, ‚Äúif I can kill you, I‚Äôll kill you,‚Äù it‚Äôs a clear message that he‚Äôs not messing around.

For the longest time, people have dared Paul ‚Äî boxing‚Äôs greatest interloper ‚Äî to fight someone his own age. His own weight. His own sport. Somebody who doesn‚Äôt carry an asterisk to the ring, as the 57-year-old Mike Tyson did, or the scars from a recent hip replacement surgery, as Ben Askren did. Somebody who has been in boxing longer than he has, which Tyron Woodley and Anderson Silva hadn‚Äôt. Somebody not shot or linked to drug cartels, like Julio C√©sar Ch√°vez Jr.

When Paul faced off with Gervonta Davis, the Big Boxing Brand who was originally scheduled to be his next opponent, ‚ÄúTank‚Äù looked like he needed at least six more years of growth before he‚Äôd ever fit into his clothes. If that weren‚Äôt bad enough, Davis‚Äô powerful indifference became that of the public at large, which is never a good sign for a fight.

Yet each time Paul faces off with Joshua, as he did once again on Wednesday in Miami, the scribes begin penning his obituary. Chael Sonnen calls it the ‚Äúbiggest mismatch in sport in my lifetime.‚Äù If anything, the spirit of bullydom switched hosts. If you were worried about Mike Tyson getting hurt fighting a young, powerful puncher, this time the worry is that the masquerade had gone too far. Listen, Jake, when we said fight a real boxer, we didn‚Äôt mean a heavyweight who can send your head into the mezzanine.

What is he doing? When you look at Paul‚Äôs trajectory, it‚Äôs been one of gradual and at times comical escalation, a careful management of risk. Going from Askren to Woodley was going from a collegiate wrestler with no striking to a collegiate wrestler with decent striking, was a subtle level-up. Neither were boxers. Then to Anderson Silva, who was 47, yes, but at least better striker. The loss to Tommy Fury was a sad affair, and nobody thinks about the Nate Diaz match, as it underwhelmed so drastically.

The line between a publicity stunt and a fair, competitive fight has been a hard one to navigate through Paul‚Äôs run in the boxing ring.

And really, the boxers Paul beat most recently ‚Äî the elder Tyson and Chavez Jr. ‚Äî only made the cries for him to fight a relevant boxer of this era all the louder. But to fight Joshua? Just because you were in a pinch to fulfill a Netflix date after Tank was ousted for criminal behavior? This is the other end of the extreme.

Not sure if this is the most courageous act he‚Äôs done, or the most foolish, but the answer is yes. It‚Äôs all those things.

The spectacle alone is enough for alarm. Paul, the self-professed ‚Äúface of boxing,‚Äù comes eye level with Joshua‚Äôs gold necklace when they face off. If Paul sees himself as David taking on Goliath, that‚Äôs the new wrinkle, yet he still feels more like the cloven-hooved Pan. He held his belly out toward Joshua to give the visual the appropriate absurdity, yet seeing him standing there lampooning in front of such a specimen I had to think ‚Äî how does he intend to beat Joshua?

Does he intend to? Does he believe he can? Or is this a kind of boxing finale that only an influencer-turned-mogul can appreciate? The great Final Act?

So much of the Jake Paul experience has felt like a detour into the wicked imagination. Nobody asked for it, yet the curiosity keeps us coming back. It‚Äôs true that he has brought eyeballs onto the sport of boxing, though purists might believe for all the wrong reasons, and that he has done more good than harm. He has advocated for women‚Äôs boxing unlike anyone else and made Amanda Serrano into a star. He has openly butted heads with the UFC‚Äôs Dana White, which from an MMA perspective can‚Äôt help but be a welcome thing. He has made himself relevant in a sport where relevance is hard to come by.

Some like him, many can‚Äôt stand him. He‚Äôs a nuisance that everyone wants a part of.

For anyone who wants to see Paul get his ass handed to him, tune in Friday night, free with your Netflix subscription. Never has an outcome felt so certain. Joshua is far bigger, more powerful, vastly more skilled, and more seasoned. That this fight got sanctioned at all is a high wonder, yet that‚Äôs one of Paul‚Äôs specialties, presenting the kind of must-see competitive imbalance that will stop the gawker in his tracks.¬† And with Paul this time being the one with the impossible task, take a good look.

Because this one? This one feels a little like Paul is Bodhi in the original ‚ÄúPoint Break,‚Äù paddling out against the towering wave during the elusive 50-year-storm, to catch one last ride before the whole thing comes crashing down.

title: Eagles vs. Commanders preview: Series history, notable stats for Week 16
description: Here's a look at the storied history of games between these franchises with key stats to know for Saturday afternoon
fullText:
The Washington Commanders (4-10) will host the Philadelphia Eagles (9-5) in an NFC battle on Saturday afternoon as part of an NFL on FOX doubleheader, with Chicago hosting Green Bay in a critical NFC North matchup. Philadelphia leads the NFC East division with a 9-5 (.643) record and currently holds the No. 3 seed in the conference playoff picture.

The Commanders will host the Eagles in Week 16 for the second consecutive season, and Washington is looking for back-to-back NFC East wins after defeating the New York Giants 29-21 in Week 15.

With kickoff fast approaching, here is a look at the storied history of games between these franchises, with key stats to know for Saturday afternoon.

Overall: Washington has a 89-86-6 record against the Eagles.

Random note: Washington will try to win back-to-back home games against the Eagles for the first time since the 2015 and 2016 seasons.

Last five matchups: The Eagles own a 7-2 (.778) record against the Commanders with NickSirianni at the helm (including playoffs), winning each of the last four games started and finished by Jalen Hurts.

Last meeting: Philadelphia's previous meeting with Washington was in the 2024 NFC Championship Game at Lincoln Financial Field, when the Eagles set an NFL playoff record for points scored (W, 55-23) en route to Super Bowl LIX.

In Washington: At home, Washington has a 46-41-3 record against Philadelphia.

Last meeting in Washington: Last season, the Commanders defeated the Eagles 36-33 on a last-second touchdown pass from QB Jayden Daniels to WR Jamison Crowder in Week 15.

Since 2021 (including playoffs), Philadelphia is 41-2 (.953) when it wins the turnover battle, including a 7-0 mark in 2025.

Washington has a 17-19 record on Saturdays. The last time Washington played on a Saturday was in 2022, when theyfaced off against the San Francisco 49ers.

The Eagles' head coach is among the most outstanding winners in NFL history to start a career. Among Super Bowl-winning head coaches, only John Madden (.759, 1969-78) and Vince Lombardi (.738, 1959-67 and 69) have won at a greater clip than Nick Sirianni (.695, 57-25) (6th in NFL history).

Sirianni is one win away from tying Greasy Neale (64, 1941-50) for the 2nd-most by a head coach in Eagles history (including playoffs). Neale led the Eagles to the 1948 and 1949 NFL Championships.

Take out the game against Chicago, and Vic Fangio very well could have the best unit in the NFL. Entering this matchup with Washington, Philadelphia has owned one of the NFL's best defenses since its bye week. Dating back to Week 10, the Eagles rank 1st in opponent completion percentage (51.5%) and fourth-down defense (14.3%); 2nd in opponent passer rating (67.2); 3rd in defensive points allowed per game (14.3), pressures (90), QB hits (45), yards allowed per pass (5.2) and FFs (5, tied); 4th in sacks (19); and 5th in takeaways (9, tied).

This season, Philadelphia has held opponents to the league's lowest completion percentage (56.0%). That is the Eagles‚Äô best figure allowed through 14 contests since the 2008 campaign (53.9%). Philadelphia has surrendered just 13 passing TDs, which ranks 2nd in the NFL, trailing only L.A. Chargers (12). The Eagles remain the only NFL team that has not allowed a passing TD on third or fourth down (last NFL team to do so through 14 games was the 2008 Colts).

The Eagles rank 5th in the NFL in defensive EPA (70.9), behind Seattle (111.1), Houston (99.6), Cleveland (98.9), and L.A. Rams (74.8).

Cooper DeJean leads all slot CBs in run defense grade (83.0), passer rating allowed (61.7), and yards allowed per coverage snap (0.67) (min. 125 run defense snaps, 40 targets, and 250 coverage snaps). For his career, DeJean has never allowed a passing TD when in the slot.

Since returning to the Eagles‚Äô defense in Week 7, Nakobe Dean has recorded the highest PFF pass rush grade (92.3), pass rush win rate (30.0%), and pressure percentage (36.7%) among NFL off-ball LBs (min. 30 pass rush snaps). In that span, Dean, who is the first Eagle to have multiple strip-sacks since Haason Reddick in 2022, ranks 2nd among off-ball LBs with 4.0 sacks, behind Eric Wilson (5.0). He is also the only player with 50+ tackles (53), 4.0+ sacks, and 2+ FFs since Week 7.

Jalyx Hunt is one of only three NFL players with 20+ QB hits (20) and multiple takeaways (2 INTs) this year, joining Will Anderson and Aidan Hutchinson (the only player with 20+ QB hits and 2+ INTs). Since Week 10, Hunt ranks T-5th in the NFL in QB hits (10), behind Myles Garrett (17), Micah Parsons (12), Danielle Hunter (11), and Osa Odighizuwa (11).

This article originally appeared on Eagles Wire: Eagles vs. Commanders preview: 10 stats to know for Week 16

title: The keys to the Seahawks vs Rams huge one in the rain, wind--and the pick
description: Wind is going to be a factor. So is the multiple defense coach Mike Macdonald will have against Sean McVay‚Äôs Rams offense.
fullText:
Biggest game of the year. Biggest game yet for Sam Darnold with his Seahawks.

What‚Äôs Seattle‚Äôs quarterback doing to prepare best for the Los Angeles Rams and this NFC West Battle Royale Thursday night at Lumen Field for the division lead and inside track to the top seed plus bye in next month‚Äôs conference playoffs?

‚ÄúTo be honest, I‚Äôm not up all-night studying,‚Äù Darnold said of the three days between the Seahawks‚Äô win over Indianapolis and this showdown between two 11-3 teams. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs making sure that I get my sleep, get my recovery in, because it is such a short week.‚Äù

There could be a lot for Darnold to study, in an effort to spring surprises on the Rams.

Yet Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald and offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak have spent this week balancing installing new plays in the game plan the Rams haven‚Äôt seen on film this season versus not overloading Seattle‚Äôs players with too much. The coaches want their Seahawks to play fast, to not think about too much new they crammed into the players‚Äô heads Monday into Thursday this week. The Seahawks ‚Äî and the Rams, for that matter ‚Äî have been practicing plays for weeks if not months they‚Äôve yet to use in a game, to surprise their opponent with new looks in the first Thursday night in NFL history feature two teams with 11 or more wins.

That‚Äôs the first key to this game: Be new, but while playing fast.

‚ÄúI think you could use it to your advantage,‚Äù Macdonald said of the short week. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre decisive in how you want to operate and they‚Äôre the right decisions, I think that‚Äôll help you. Sometimes, it might be behind the 8-ball.

‚ÄúA kick in the butt doesn‚Äôt necessarily hurt you.‚Äù

So what‚Äôs the new that will be key Thursday night?

Look for Macdonald to use the combination of rookie Nick Emmanwori at all three levels of the defense with Pro Bowl cornerback Devon Witherspoon blitzing more and Seattle‚Äôs recent three-cornerback rotation with Riq Woolen and Josh Jobe giving the Seahawks new personnel options against coach Sean McVay‚Äôs Rams offense.

No team in the league plays in ‚Äú13‚Äù personnel ‚Äî one running back, three tight ends ‚Äî more than McVay‚Äôs Rams, 25% of the time; the league average is 5%. No team played the Rams‚Äô ‚Äú13‚Äù personnel with nickel and an extra, fifth defensive back more than the Seahawks did last month in L.A.‚Äôs 21-19 home win.

Rams No. 2 wide receiver Davante Adams, the NFL‚Äôs leader with 14 touchdown receptions, is doubtful to play because of an injured hamstring. That may lead McVay to even more ‚Äú13‚Äù personnel sets.

The Rams average 6.1 yards per play in their three-tight ends formations this season. Against Macdonald‚Äôs Seahawks last month L.A. got just 2.7 yards in McVay‚Äôs ‚Äú13‚Äù personnel.

In all formations, Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford had by one measure the worst game of his 17-year NFL career last month against Seattle. His expected points added (EPA) passing in that game was the lowest of his career.

McVay‚Äôs offense had its lowest EPA in two seasons last month against Macdonald‚Äôs Seahawks defense. Can Seattle do it again?

The weather is forecast to be conducive to running over throwing the ball: A 50% chance of rain with winds 15 mph gusting toward 35 mph around the 5:15 p.m. kickoff, then throughout the game.

‚ÄúYeah, it‚Äôll factor into some of the decisions that we make,‚Äù Macdonald said, grinning to conceal exactly which ones.

Kubiak has shown he‚Äôs going to run the ball, regardless of the results. Seattle gained just 49 yards last week against the Colts, a top-10 run defense in the NFL. Yet the Seahawks ran it 22 times. No team in the league comes close to running it as often as Seattle‚Äôs 48% of all offensive plays. Yet the Seahawks are fifth-to-last with just 3.9 yards per rush.

Last week, they ran for a season low 2.3 yards per carry against Indianapolis.

The Rams are ninth in the league in rushing defense.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs got to improve pretty quick,‚Äù Kubiak said of the Seahawks running game.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got to move the ball better on the ground. We‚Äôve got to coach better. We‚Äôve got to block better. We‚Äôve got to help the operation by being a more balanced team.‚Äù

Expect a pointed effort by Kubiak handing the ball to lead back Kenneth Walker early and often. Walker had 2.4 yards per rush in the last two games (19 carries, 46 yards). He‚Äôs had defenders standing waiting for him in the backfield immediately as he receives handoffs from Darnold.

Thursday, Walker is going to be running behind a new left tackle: Josh Jones is making his first Seattle start, for injured Charles Cross.

The Seahawks drove inside the Rams‚Äô 20-yard line four times in that November game in Inglewood, California. They got just one touchdown out of those four red-zone trips.

Last week against the Colts the Seahawks were 0 for 2 scoring TDs in the red zone. Seattle‚Äôs offensive moved inside the Indianapolis 35 four times. Yet the only offense was a team-record six field goals by Jason Myers in the 18-16 escape win.

For the season, the Seahawks are in the bottom half of the NFL, 17th in the 32-team league, in red-zone TD percentage (57.5%). They‚Äôve been just 37.5% the last three weeks, the fourth-worst in the NFL in that span.

Minimize penalties. Eliminate negative plays. And of course be far better than the career-high four interceptions Darnold threw in the last game against the Rams, handing L.A. two of their three touchdowns.

The Seahawks must score touchdowns, seven points, instead of field goals when they get close against L.A.

‚ÄúAgain, the last few games moving the ball up and down the field, I feel like we‚Äôve been solid,‚Äù Darnold said. ‚ÄúThird downs can improve a little bit‚Äî or a lot, I think I should say. Then in the red zone, it‚Äôs a matter of keeping the ball moving forward.

‚ÄúWhen you get in those second and long, third and longs, that makes it hard to convert. So, just keeping the ball moving forward, not only in the red zone, but also in the field, as well.‚Äù

Yes, this is one of the biggest regular-season games Seattle‚Äôs played in a minute. The winner is two more wins from the NFC West title and home-field plus a bye in the conference playoffs, meaning two home postseason games from the Super Bowl. The loser is headed to the fifth seed, and needing to win three road playoff games to reach the Super Bowl.

Yet the Seahawks coach doesn‚Äôt see it in that lens.

‚ÄúLook, I get it. It‚Äôs your job to put all the meaning behind it,‚Äù Macdonald said.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs our job to go play great football.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all good, and I get it. It‚Äôs exciting. But every game‚Äôs exciting.‚Äù Darnold doesn‚Äôt turn the ball over. Walker gets (some) more than he‚Äôs gotten recently on the ground. Macdonald‚Äôs defense again stymies McVay‚Äôs offense with new tricks.

title: Davante Adams injury status for Rams in Week 16
description: Here's what we know about Davante Adams' health ahead of a big game with the Seahawks.
fullText:
There's no need to mince words. Thursday night's matchup between the Los Angeles Rams and Seattle Seahawks has massive NFC playoff implications. The winner of said game will likely have the inside track to the conference's No. 1 seed throughout the postseason next month, which obviously means guaranteed homefield advantage and the sole bye week available.

Unfortunately for the Rams, who beat the Seahawks at home earlier this season, they will have to overcome their NFC West rival on the road without one of their best players.

Veteran star receiver Davante Adams is likely to miss Thursday's game with a left hamstring injury. It's a reaggravation of the same injury Adams suffered earlier this season. The Rams apparently don't believe Adams' injury is of a long-term variety. He could theoretically return as soon as next week. But with the postseason around the corner, they're rightfully proceeding with caution so one of their top playmakers is healthy and can play in the biggest games.

Even still, a road game against the team nipping at your heels in the NFC and NFC West is probably the worst game to miss. Alas, the Rams are definitely more equipped than most to survive without Adams for at least one week:

Rams are listing WR Davante Adams as doubtful for Thursday night‚Äôs game in Seattle due to his hamstring injury. pic.twitter.com/pDs8Tx533A

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) December 17, 2025

We'll see how the Rams fare without Adams, who leads the team in touchdowns (14) and is second in both catches and receiving yards.

Jordan Whittington is listed as Adams' backup on the Rams' depth chart. Whittington is in his second NFL season after being drafted in the sixth round of the 2024 NFL Draft.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Davante Adams injury update: When is Rams star coming back?

title: Seahawks vs. Rams weather updates: How gusty winds in Seattle could cause trouble for 'Thursday Night Football'
description: Thursday night's game at Lumen Field is set to feature heavy winds that could disrupt the Rams and Seahawks.
fullText:
Seahawks vs. Rams weather updates: How gusty winds in Seattle could cause trouble for 'Thursday Night Football' originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Thursday night's matchup between the Seattle Seahawks and Los Angeles Rams could have significant consequences for the NFC playoff picture.

Not only are the two squads each coming in with an 11-3 record atop the NFC West, but the San Francisco 49ers also sit at 10-4, meaning there could be a shake-up in both the division and wild-card standings with the result of "Thursday Night Football."

As two of the NFC's elite teams meet, however, there's a chance that each team's run game becomes essential ‚Äî winds are expected to be heavy for Rams vs. Seahawks.

Here's the latest on the conditions in Seattle for Thursday night's game.

MORE:The Sporting News' latest 2026 NFL Mock Draft

11:47 a.m. ‚Äî As things stand the morning prior to "Thursday Night Football," the weather around kickoff is expected to include wind gusts of up to 30 mph, plus a light rain/drizzle, per Accuweather.

According to Kevin Roth, there could even be gusts of wind up to 40 mph, and it will particularly be more of a challenge around kickoff time.

üèà‚òîÔ∏èüå¨Ô∏è The most interesting weather game of NFL Week 16 comes right out of the gate on #TNF

Multiple models are showing a brief period of powerful winds pregame and through kickoff, gusting around 40mph (and even stronger pregame).

Those winds taper off a bit as the game goes‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/nwdHiVeyum

‚Äî Kevin Roth (@KevinRothWx) December 17, 2025

Per Accuweather, around 8 p.m. ET (with kickoff scheduled for 8:15 p.m. ET) in Seattle on Thursday night, it will be around 50 degrees with a 56% chance of rain and southwest winds of 16 mph.

Closer to 10 and 11 p.m. ET, the temperature is expected to slightly drop toward 46-48 degrees, with chances of precipitation decreasing. However, it's the wind gusts that may have the most significant effect on Seahawks vs. Rams.

MORE:Updated NFL playoff picture

Wind gusts around kickoff for Rams vs. Seahawks are expected to be around 30 mph, per Accuweather, with others estimating they could even reach 40 mph. However, throughout the evening, those wind gusts are expected to ease up into the 15-20 mph range.

Those conditions, especially around the time of the first quarter, could making throwing and kicking the ball difficult for Seattle and Los Angeles as they meet with the NFC West potentially on the line.

title: Houston Texans statistics: Jayden Higgins, Jaylin Noel vs. Cardinals
description: How did our resident Cyclone Twins hold up last week against the Arizona Cardinals?
fullText:
Welcome to week 15 of the Cyclone tracker!

This is where we follow our resident weather-themed duo in rookie receivers¬†Jayden Higgins¬†and¬†Jaylin Noel, both out of Iowa State (hence, the ‚ÄúCyclone‚Äù twins).

As always, there will be analysis, projections, commentary, and relevant updates that happen in real time.

Projected Week 15 storm path:¬†5.0 targets, 3.0 receptions, 25.5 yards, 0.1 TD, 5.5 fantasy points

Actual Week 15 path:¬†1 target, 1 reception, 4 yards (4.0 avg.), 0 TDs, 1.4 fantasy pts

Total stats through Week 15: 56 targets, 36 receptions, 397 yards (11.0 avg.), 4 TDs, 99.7 fantasy pts

Analysis:¬†It was a relatively quiet Sunday afternoon for the former Iowa State Cyclone, as Jayden Higgins found himself with only one target for four yards in the Texans‚Äô 40-20 win over the Arizona Cardinals.

Higgins had been on a five-game streak of at least 3+ catches, dating back to week 10‚Äôs 36-29 win against the Jacksonville Jaguars. Yet, it is a positive development for the team that they can blow out teams in a myriad of ways that don‚Äôt involve putting too much pressure on their rookies to perform.

He has a chance to bounce back against the Las Vegas Raiders and their 29th-ranked pass defense (173.4 yards/game).

Week 16 statistical projections:¬†4.0 targets, 2.5 receptions, 25.5 yards, 0.1 TD, 3.9 fantasy points

Projected week 15 storm path:¬†2 targets, 1.0 receptions, 9.5 yards, 0.1 TD, 2.5 fantasy points

Actual week 15 path:¬†0 targets, 0 receptions, 0 yards, 0 TD‚Äôs, 3 ret, 121 return yards (40.3 yd avg.), 0.0 fantasy pts

Total stats through week 15: 30 targets, 22 receptions, 225 yards (10.2 yd avg.), 801 return yards, 1 TD,¬†36.4 fantasy pts

Analysis:¬†Jaylin Noel continues to add to his historic rookie season on special teams.

After his 21 return yards against the Kansas City Chiefs set the franchise record for most punt return yards (293) for a Texans rookie, he added 13 more against the Arizona Cardinals to bring his record up to 306.

He did this in the midst of his most explosive day as a returner, when he exploded for a 69-yard return and eclipsed 120+ return yards for the game.

Jaylin Noel with the 69-yard return! üòè pic.twitter.com/bTZCBJUkDl

‚Äî Cardinal & Gold Report (@cardgoldrpt) December 14, 2025

Beggars can‚Äôt be choosers. While Noel was yet again not featured in the Texans‚Äô passing offense, his being unleashed in the return game completely changes the dynamic of how Houston schemes up their offense.

Noel has elite field flipping ability in the return game, and the Texans are all the better for his continued contributions to the team‚Äôs dramatic season turnaround.

Week 16 Projections:¬†2 targets, 1.0 receptions, 9.5 yards, 0.1 TD, 2.5 fantasy points

All stats and projections provided courtesy of¬†ESPN,¬†RotoBaller,¬†FantasyPros,¬†Fantasy Data¬†and¬†PFF.

title: Why Alex Albon has "so much confidence" Williams can produce great 2026 F1 car
description: Albon thinks his Williams Formula 1 team has now laid the foundations to start bridging the gap to the top teams
fullText:
Williams Formula 1 driver Alex Albon says he has "so much confidence" his team can take another step forward after its rise to fifth in 2025.

Williams secured a comfortable fifth place in last season's championship as the experienced and rapid combination of Albon and new team-mate Carlos Sainz combined for 137 points,- the Grove-based squad's best result in a decade.

Even if the squad has been largely focused on 2026 and beyond, its 2025 campaign is the result of a rapid transformation of the team behind the scenes, led by team boss James Vowles and sanctioned by owner Dorilton Capital.

Following a troubled 2024 campaign that was marked by costly crashes, a late and overweight launch car and various operational errors, 2025 has given Albon confidence that Williams is now in a much better place to set its sights on the front four teams, rather than look over its shoulder.

"We've had a few years where we took a step back. I think 2024 stands out to me as a year of setbacks," Albon said. "But the foundations of the team became a lot healthier, and you saw a big jump from 2024 to 2025. There's a great positivity, great culture within the team, great optimism as well. There's confidence in the team as well.

"I feel like we're a team that can do great things. Even if we were to start slow [in 2026], I think we've got a great team behind us who can find solutions and adapt quickly.

"I've been in this team when we did our first regulation change in 2022, and it was a tough year. I look at our team now and see how much healthier we are. I have so much confidence in the team to deliver a good car next year."

Williams returned to the podium in 2025 with two hard-earned third places for Sainz in Azerbaijan and Qatar. But Albon was also keen to point out there is still a big gap between F1's traditional front four of McLaren, Mercedes, Red Bull and Ferrari and the rest of the midfield.

Alex Albon highlights Carlos Sainz pairing as key to Williams' F1 2025 success

"The gap from P10 to P5 is smaller than the gap from P5 to P1, or even from P5 to P4," he pointed out. "So, we know that we've still got a long road ahead of us, but I'm hoping my podium chances come a little bit sooner rather than later."

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Crazy eight(een)s ‚Äì Part one
description: Part one of a look at players who have worn the number 18 for the Phillies
fullText:
Two years ago, as part of my celebration of Chanukah, I examined some of the players who have worn the number eight for the Phillies. For this year‚Äôs celebration, I decided to add ten to the number and look at some of the more notable players who have donned 18.

One curious thing I discovered: The Phillies have never had a player with a number in the 80s. Seven of the ten 70‚Äôs numbers have been used, as have four in the nineties. But in all these years, not once has a player chosen to wear a two-digit number starting with eight.

I also learned that unlike eight, eighteen has not been a successful number for the Phillies. Only one player has kept it for more than three seasons, and most of the prominent players who have worn it went on to switch to other numbers as their careers advanced.

The first Phillies to wear the 18 was righthanded pitcher Chet Nichols who donned it for eleven games in 1932. Nichols set a bad precedent for the number by putting up a 6.98 ERA. He was out of the league the following year.

Before starting Genesis, Phil Collins spent seven years as a pitcher with the Phillies. (It‚Äôs possible that they are actually two different people.) Collins wore four different numbers in his career, and as it turns out, the season he wore 18 was one of his worst.

#OTD 1935 ‚Äì The Cardinals purchased Phil Collins from the Philadelphia Phillies.

Collins would go on to become the drummer/singer of the rock band Genesis and then launch a successful solo career. ü§£#STLCards #ForTheLou pic.twitter.com/mzR6yRMfrm

‚Äî Augie Nash (@AugieNash) May 7, 2025

Three different players wore 18 in 1933, and none distinguished themselves. The number then went unused until 1938 when lefty Al Smith took it on. Smith would have some solid seasons in the majors, but none of them came with the Phillies.

The number 18 was passed around to a bunch of players in the next few years. None of these players were especially noteworthy, and most quickly left town shortly after arriving. Sam Nahem even wore it twice, bookending military service with two unimpressive stints with the team.

Milo Candini wasn‚Äôt the best player to wear the 18, but he put up a decent season for the Whiz Kids in 1950. The righthanded reliever put up a 2.70 ERA in 18(!) games for the pennant winners.

Today in Relief Room history 1949 the #Phillies select Milo Candini from OAK of the PCL in the Rule 5 draft. He was average in his 33G here but he's in the Manteca HOF & has a street named for him in his home town of Manteca CA. Plus what a handsome devil. pic.twitter.com/Sxw6T4q2Tg

‚Äî TheReliefRoom (@TheReliefRoom) November 17, 2025

Chris Short had a long successful career with the Phillies‚Ä¶but most of that success came wearing number 41. He switched out of the 18 after a three-game cameo in his first year in the majors.

Ryne Duren was a three-time All-Star with the Yankees early in his career. Those days were past him when he joined the Phillies in 1963, but he still pitched effectively that season. (3.30 ERA) The Phillies couldn‚Äôt have been that impressed, because they sold him to the Reds early in 1964. That may have worked out in Duren‚Äôs favor as he got to avoid the team‚Äôs September collapse.

Similar to Chris Short, Rick Wise had a successful career that started out with an unsuccessful season wearing the number 18. He pitched in six September games for the 1964 Phillies, and understandably wanted to change things up when he returned to the majors two years later.

Hebner was a mainstay for the Pirates before signing with the Phillies as a free agent before the 1977 season. The first baseman turned in two solid offensive seasons for the National League East champs.

OTD in 1976, free agent Richie Hebner signed with @Phillies Phillies. 

Coming off 2 subpar years, Hebner, who had topped .290 in four separate seasons w @Pittsburgh, rebounded nicely in 1977, batting .285 with 18 home runs to help lead Philadelphia to a NL East division title. pic.twitter.com/TCp8xdSAha

‚Äî 1970s Baseball (@70sBaseball) December 15, 2019

‚ÄúVuk‚Äù didn‚Äôt have the most prolific playing career, but the infielder wore 18 while mostly sitting on the bench for the 1980 World Series champions. He was a very popular clubhouse figure and went on to serve as a coach for the team from 1988 to 2004. For his work as a coach, he was elected to the team‚Äôs Wall of Fame in 2007.

Today is the 18th, what player did you like that wore that number? Mine was John Vukovich. #Phillies #RingTheBell pic.twitter.com/SmRcgkHoFg

‚Äî PhilsRedOctober (@PhilsRedOctober) November 18, 2025

There aren‚Äôt good records on what numbers coaches wore but seeing that the 18 was sparsely used during that time, it stands to reason than Vukovich used it and might have occasionally switched if a player requested it.

As I warned you, that wasn‚Äôt the most prolific list of players in Phillies history. I‚Äôll be back tomorrow with part two, which will consist of more guys you‚Äôve heard of (for better or worse.)

title: FOX Sports, IndyCar reveal broadcast schedule for 2026 season
description: All 17 rounds will be featured on broadcast television
fullText:
FOX Sports and IndyCar have announced the race broadcast start times for the upcoming 2026 season.

For the second consecutive year, IndyCar will have a record 19 network windows, with all 17 races featured on broadcast television. It is also the second time in as many years that IndyCar will be the only premier motorsports series in North America with all races broadcast on network television.

Unique to this upcoming season is the summer stretch that also features FOX Sports‚Äô coverage of the 2026 FIFA World Cup. The opening match on Sunday, June 21, will lead into the IndyCar Series round at Road America set for 2 pm (all times Eastern). That theme continues as one game in the World Cup‚Äôs round of 16 follows the 12:30 pm start time for the race at Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course on July 5.

The only broadcast time unconfirmed is the Music City Grand Prix at Nashville Superspeedway on Sunday, July 19, with the 400-mile race immediately following the FIFA World Cup Final. A start time will be confirmed at a later date.

The 2025 season was the first year of IndyCar‚Äôs multi-year partnership with FOX Sports, with viewership increasing 27% from the previous season. It was the ‚Äúfastest growth curve of any major sport,‚Äù according to the press release.

‚ÄúOnce again FOX Sports is providing an unparalleled platform to showcase the most competitive and dynamic racing series on the planet,‚Äù Penske Entertainment Corp. president and CEO Mark Miles said. ‚ÄúOn the heels of significant milestones and momentum last year, this new season will provide meaningful opportunities to reach new audiences and build upon the best growth trajectory in all of sports.‚Äù

Other notables of the broadcast schedule include the second round of the season at Phoenix Raceway, which will be a unique shared weekend with NASCAR. IndyCar‚Äôs return to the 1-mile oval for the first time since 2018 will see race coverage for North America‚Äôs premier open-wheel championship begin at 3 pm Sunday, March 7.

The inaugural Grand Prix of Arlington is set for Sunday, March 15, with a 30-minute prerace beginning at 12:30 pm.

Coverage for qualifying for the 110th Running of the Indianapolis 500 begins at 4 pm on Saturday, May 16 and Sunday, May 17. Additionally, ‚ÄúThe Greatest Spectacle in Racing‚Äù on Sunday, May 24 will feature an extensive six-hour broadcast for the second consecutive year, beginning at 10 am.

IndyCar boss Doug Boles explains new officiating system

IndyCar‚Äôs debut round on the Streets of Markham at 12 pm on Sunday, August 16.

Lastly, the 2026 season finale is set for Labor Day weekend in a return to Laguna Seca, with coverage beginning with a prerace show at 2:30 pm on Sunday, Sept. 6.

"There is so much to look forward to on the 2026 NTT IndyCar Series schedule, including our first race at Arlington,‚Äù said Pato O‚ÄôWard, driver of the No. 5 Arrow McLaren Chevrolet. ‚ÄúAs we have already seen in this new partnership, it is one of the most exciting, new additions to our calendar in recent years, and FOX Sports will provide the perfect showcase for our fans watching on TV. The new season can‚Äôt get here soon enough."

Coverage of all IndyCar practice and qualifying sessions will be featured on either FS1 or FS2, FOX One and the FOX Sports app. The coverage schedule for Indy NXT, the development category for IndyCar, will be announced at a later date.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a big sports fan, so having the 2026 IndyCar schedule share the stage with FOX‚Äôs coverage of the World Cup next summer is going to be exciting," said Kyle Kirkwood, driver of the No. 27 Andretti Global Honda. "2025 was a breakout year for me, and it was especially rewarding to see it all play out on FOX in their first IndyCar season. We‚Äôre looking forward to another strong season for the No. 27 Andretti Global Honda, and I‚Äôm eager to see what FOX has in store for the upcoming season.‚Äù

FOX SPORTS‚Äô 2026 NTT INDYCAR SERIES RACE COVERAGE SCHEDULE:

Indianapolis Motor Speedway Road Course

WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Jake Paul vs. Anthony Joshua weigh-in video
description: Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua step to the scale ahead of Friday‚Äôs fight
fullText:
At the Paul vs. Joshua weigh-ins, Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua will step on the scale Thursday in Miami.

Paul and Joshua have to weigh in at a maximum of 245 pounds for their eight-round heavyweight main event showdown Friday.

In the co-main event, super featherweight champion Alycia Baumgardner defends her titles against Leila Beaudoin in a 12-round contest. Baumgardner and Beaudoin must weight in at or below the championship limit of 130 pounds. This marks Baumgardner‚Äôs fourth defense as undisputed champion.

Also featured on the card is a boxing match between former UFC champions Anderson Silva and Tyron Woodley. Silva is widely regarded as one of the greatest MMA fighters of all time, having defended the UFC‚Äôs middleweight title 10 consecutive times from 2006-2013, while Woodley successfully defended the promotion‚Äôs welterweight championship four times.

title: Texas RB Rickey Stewart expected to enter the NCAA transfer portal
description: Stewart did not make an appearance for the Longhorns in his one season in the program.
fullText:
Texas Longhorns freshman running back Rickey Stewart is expected to enter the NCAA transfer portal when the window opens in January, according to a Thursday report from Inside Texas.

Stewart is the second running back whose intentions to enter the portal have become public, joining redshirt sophomore CJ Baxter, and is departing the Forty Acres without appearing in a game for the Longhorns.

A member of the 2025 recruiting class out of Tyler Chapel Hill, the 5‚Äô10, 197-pounder committed to former running backs coach Tashard Choice and played under former running backs coach Chad Scott, who was terminated last week by head coach Steve Sarkisian. Initially pledged to SMU, Stewart committed to Texas after receiving his offer from the Longhorns prior to taking official visits to both schools. When Stewart signed with Texas, he was a consensus four-star prospect ranked as the No. 419 prospect nationally and the No. 29 running back, according to the 247Sports Composite rankings.

Stewart spent the 2025 season as the last scholarship running back on the depth chart and is moving on as the Horns restructure the position room in the midst of new assistant Jabbar Juluke attempting to bring Jadan Baugh with him from Florida.

title: Where Auburn basketball ranks in KenPom ahead of showdown with Purdue
description: Here's a look at where the Auburn Tigers rank in the KenPom ahead of Saturday's massive game with Purdue.
fullText:
The Auburn Tigers are set to face one last challenge in nonconference action this Saturday when they travel to Indianapolis to face the No. 6 Purdue Boilermakers at Gainbridge Fieldhouse.

With the game being played on a neutral court, it will be a quad-1 opportunity for both teams. The No. 24 Tigers check in at No. 35 in the NET, while Purdue will enter the game ranked No. 9. Purdue is 2-1 in such games with wins over Alabama on the road and Texas Tech on a neutral site in the Bahamas. Auburn is 1-3, with its lone win coming against St. John's in Las Vegas as part of the Players' Era Festival.

Analytically, the offense will be a key focal point as both teams rank in the top 15 in offensive efficiency according to KenPom, with Purdue holding the edge defensively. Tempo-wise, Purdue has a great chance of controlling the clock as the Boilermakers rank near the bottom nationally in tempo. Mixing in the fact that the game will be played in a Purdue-heavy environment in Indianapolis, Auburn will need to be extra motivated to pull off the upset.

Here is a breakdown of where Auburn ranks in major categories measured by KenPom ahead of Saturday's game against Purdue.

The Tigers continue to play above preseason expectations by ranking No. 30, one spot ahead of their preseason outlook. Heading into Thursday, Auburn has wins over two teams ranked ahead of them in KenPom... St. John's (No. 18), and NC State (No. 28).

Auburn is playing offense at a high level, according to KenPom's data. The Tigers are the third-most-efficient offense in the SEC with a rating of 122.7. The Tigers average 86.5 points per game, which ranks No. 9 among SEC teams as the nonconference portion of the schedule winds down.

Auburn's defensive struggles are visible through the KenPom. The Tigers rank No. 77 in the latest KenPom update, which is No. 11 among SEC teams and one spot higher than conference rival Texas. The Tigers are No. 14 in the conference in points allowed (76.8), No. 15 in field goal percentage (.438), No. 8 in defensive rebounds (33.1), and No. 6 in blocked shots (51).

Auburn is slightly above the national average in this category with 69.3 possessions per game. They will look to make the most of their possessions on Saturday as Purdue is considered one of the "slowest" teams in the country in this regard.

Auburn's combined opponent offensive efficiency rating ranks No. 41 in the nation (111.6), and ranks No. 23 defensively (103.9), which adds up to give Auburn one of the toughest schedules in the country.

Here's how Purdue stacks up with Auburn in the latest KenPom update ahead of Saturday's game.

Adjusted offensive efficiency: No. 1 (127.1)

Adjusted defensive efficiency: No. 24 (97.3)

Prediction: Purdue has a 77% chance of winning on Saturday, with an implied score of 82-74.

Contact/Follow us @TheAuburnWire on¬† X (Twitter), and like our page on Facebook to follow ongoing coverage of Auburn news, notes, and opinions. You can also follow Taylor on Twitter @TaylorJones__

This article originally appeared on Auburn Wire: Auburn basketball KenPom ranking before Purdue game

title: Raptors vs Bucks Prediction, Picks & Odds for Tonight‚Äôs NBA Game
description: Our Raptors vs. Bucks predictions expect Immanuel Quickley to lead Toronto to victory in Milwaukee.
fullText:
The Milwaukee Bucks are a franchise on the precipice. They were struggling to support superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo when he was on the court, and without him, they‚Äôve been downright awful.

Tonight, they‚Äôll host a Toronto Raptors team dealing with its own set of injuries, but look much closer to pulling themselves out of their slump than Milwaukee does.

My Raptors vs. Bucks predictions and NBA picks break down tonight's Eastern Conference matchup.

Raptors vs Bucks best bet: Immanuel Quickley Over 16.5 points (-115)

No matter what you think of this¬†Milwaukee Bucks situation, Giannis Antetokounmpo won‚Äôt be on the court when they host the Toronto Raptors tonight.

Things have been so bad for the Bucks that the Raptors are 5.5-point road favorites in this matchup, and that‚Äôs despite Toronto going through its own struggles. The Raptors have been in a slump since RJ Barrett went down with a knee injury.

Now, the Raps are starting to play a little better, coming off a 106-96 win over the Heat, but that's the only time they've covered the spread in their last nine games. Still, what the Raptors have is firepower against a shaky Bucks defense.

That has me looking at the point total for Raptors guard Immanuel Quickley. IQ got off to a slow start this season, but he‚Äôs started to find his rhythm lately. He is averaging 19.1 points per game while shooting 41.2% from 3-point range over his last seven games.

He'll face a Bucks team that ranks 24th in defensive rating and ranks 21st in opponent 3-point attempts and makes per game. His point total sits at 16.5, a number he's gone Over in four of his last seven games.

The other thing the Bucks have really struggled with is cleaning the glass. They rank next-to-last in the NBA in rebounding rate, and that‚Äôs with one of the NBA‚Äôs best rebounders for half of their games.

So, without Giannis, Scottie Barnes shouldn‚Äôt face much resistance on the boards. Barnes averages 7.9 rebounds per game, and his rebounding prop sits at 8.5, a number he‚Äôs gone Over in six of his last 10 games.

While both of these teams are struggling, the Raptors are in a better position and have more depth at the moment. They‚Äôve had trouble covering spreads, but I think they pull out the win.

title: How IndyCar hopes to build its fanbase with races during the World Cup
description: Here's when Fox will broadcast IndyCar Series races, including the Indianapolis 500. Some races will bump up against World Cup matches.
fullText:
The IndyCar Series is entering its second season with Fox Sports as its television partner, with all 17 races scheduled to be shown on the Fox broadcast network.

This year's IndyCar schedule coincides, in part, with the 2026 World Cup, which will be hosted by the United States, Canada and Mexico. Races at Road America (June 21), Mid-Ohio (July 5) and Nashville (July 19) will either precede or follow World Cup matches.

"On the heels of significant milestones and momentum last year, this new season will provide meaningful opportunities to reach new audiences and build upon the best growth trajectory in all of sports," Penske Entertainment Corp. President and CEO Mark Miles said in a statement.

Making the calls: IndyCar names board to oversee independent officiating of races

The season begins with a three-week stretch in March at St. Petersburg, Florida. (March 1), Phoenix (March 7) and Arlington, Texas (March 15).

Fox will also cover Indianapolis 500 qualifying on May 16-17, and its race coverage begins at 10 a.m. May 24.

The season concludes on Labor Day weekend at WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca in Monterey, California.

(All races are on Fox; times ET, subject to change)

Sun., March 1: Streets of St. Petersburg, noon

Sat., March 7: Phoenix Raceway, 3 p.m.

Sun., March 15: Streets of Arlington, 12:30 p.m.

Sun., March 29: Barber Motorsports Park, 1 p.m.

Sun., April 19: Streets of Long Beach, 5:30 p.m.

Sat., May 9: Indianapolis Motor Speedway road course, 4:30 p.m.

Sun., May 24: Indianapolis 500, 10 a.m.

Sun., May 31: Streets of Detroit, 12:30 p.m.

Sun., June 7: World Wide Technology Raceway, 9 p.m.

Sun., June 21: Road America, 2 p.m.

Sun., July 5: Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course, 12:30 p.m.

Sun., July 19: Nashville Superspeedway, TBA

Sun., Aug. 9: Portland International Raceway, 4 p.m.

Sun., Aug. 16: Streets of Markham (Canada), noon

Sat., Aug. 29: The Milwaukee Mile (Race 1), 2:30 p.m.

Sun., Aug. 30: The Milwaukee Mile (Race 2), 1 p.m.

Sun., Sept. 6: WeatherTech Raceway Laguna Seca, 2:30 p.m.

title: Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua have a lot to lose in Netflix bout
description: Jake Paul proudly boasts he has become the face of boxing during the past decade.  Paul will fight two-time heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua on Friday night at the Kaseya Center, home of the NBA‚Äôs Miami Heat.  The scheduled eight-round bout will be streamed on Netflix without the pay-per-view designation.
fullText:
MIAMI (AP) ‚Äî Jake Paul proudly boasts he has become the face of boxing during the past decade. Now the YouTuber-turned-fighter is ready to embark on his riskiest ring venture yet after 13 professional fights featuring a cross section of opponents that lack the active status and talent of his next rival.

Paul will fight two-time heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua on Friday night at the Kaseya Center, home of the NBA‚Äôs Miami Heat. The scheduled eight-round bout will be streamed on Netflix without the pay-per-view designation.

Although the 36-year-old Joshua (28-4, 25 KOs) has not fought since September 2024, when he was knocked out by Daniel Dubois in five rounds, he is the prohibitive favorite to derail Paul‚Äôs ambitious fight plans.

‚ÄúThe odds are stacked against me,‚Äù Paul said Wednesday in the fighters‚Äô final media appearance before the bout. ‚ÄúThere are no sporting teams in history that have gone together where it‚Äôs this big of a difference in terms of skills, experience, resume, height, weight. This is going to be the biggest upset in the history of sport and you guys get to witness it.‚Äù

In their photo standoff that closed Wednesday‚Äôs event, the 6-foot-6 Joshua towered over the 6-1 Paul. Joshua also has a six-inch reach advantage, 82-76. In addition, 12 of Paul‚Äôs bouts have been at the 200-pound cruiserweight limit.

The 28-year-old Paul (12-1, 7 KOs) has built his professional record through unconventional methods. He has victories over retired UFC champions Anderson Silva and Nate D√≠az and also won a convincing decision against former middleweight titleholder Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.

Paul‚Äôs ability to entice 58-year-old Mike Tyson to fight him last year further enhanced the circus-like atmosphere that often define his bouts. Yet, the bout against legendary heavyweight champion, which Paul won by unanimous decision, attracted 72,300 at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. The fight also generated a reported 108 million global views.

For all the followers Paul has won through his social media platforms, he acknowledges there are detractors who view him as an insult to the sport and the fighters who have traveled the arduous trek toward contention and championship opportunities.

‚ÄúNo one has done more for the sport of boxing in the past decade than myself,‚Äù said Paul, who also has formed his promotional company that will oversee Friday‚Äôs nine-bout card. ‚ÄúI think if people really cared about boxing they‚Äôd want me to win.

‚ÄúI see the angle that they‚Äôre coming from ‚Äì that (Joshua‚Äôs) the traditional boxer, that he‚Äôs been doing it for his whole life. But I think I‚Äôm more important for the sport of boxing. If they actually cared about the sport, they‚Äôd want me to win.‚Äù

Joshua, who also won an Olympic gold medal representing his native England in the 2012 Summer Games, understands his perceived role as a boxing savior against Paul.

‚ÄúIt just seems I‚Äôve been called in to save the purest of boxing,‚Äù Joshua said. ‚ÄúPeople don‚Äôt like the fact that I‚Äôm fighting Jake. Whether that concerns me or not is another question. If we look at the people that don‚Äôt want me to be here, they want me to put an end to the Jake Paul show. That‚Äôs why I have to carry boxing on my back with this fight.‚Äù

Joshua‚Äôs bout against Paul will be his second in the United States. And Joshua wants to leave the ring Friday with a better outcome than in his debut, when Andy Ruiz Jr. knocked him out in seven rounds to end his first heavyweight reign six years ago at Madison Square Garden.

‚ÄúIt was a tragedy. It was a loss,‚Äù Joshua said of his first professional defeat. ‚ÄúBut if you‚Äôre in sports, it may happen. You may take some losses but the goal is to bounce back. Through tragedy there can always be a great story. This is just part of what my life is.‚Äù

AP sports: https://apnews.com/sports

title: Plane owned by former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashes in North Carolina
description: The plane departed Statesville Regional Airport and crashed while attempting to land a short time later. It is unclear who was on the plane.
fullText:
A plane registered to former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashed at Statesville Regional Airport in Statesville, North Carolina, on Thursday. It is unclear who was on the plane at the time of the crash. Multiple reports indicate there have been multiple fatalities.

The Cessna Citation was scheduled to fly to Sarasota/Bradenton International Airport from Statesville, about 40 miles north of Charlotte. But, per FlightAware, it traveled just 29 miles before it crashed while attempting to land back at Statesville at 10:15 a.m. ET.

Multiple people have died after a plane crashed in Iredell County on Thursday morning.

Details: https://t.co/rMUGoKd8sr pic.twitter.com/mtbVbHiGg2

‚Äî WBTV News (@WBTV_News) December 18, 2025

The plane is owned by GB Aviation Leasing LLC. The address listed on the FAA registry for the plane matches an address for Biffle in Mooresville, North Carolina. A brief news conference by Statesville officials early Thursday afternoon did not provide much information other than confirming the crash took place and the airport was closed.

In 2024, Biffle, a licensed pilot, used his helicopter and pilot skills to help people in remote areas of North Carolina in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene. The hurricane had flooded out roads and caused significant infrastructure damage to the Appalachians thanks to flooding rains.

Biffle, 55, won 19 Cup Series races over his NASCAR career. His best season came in 2005, when he finished second to Tony Stewart in the points standings. Biffle‚Äôs six wins were the most of anyone in the Cup Series that season and his average finish of 11.9 was second only to Stewart.

Biffle finished in the top 10 in the Cup Series points standings in six different seasons. He was third in 2008 and finished fifth in 2012.

This post will be updated with more information.

title: TST Best Bets- December 18, 2025
description: Thursday delivers a slate built around one game that carries monumental weight in the NFL, as the Seahawks and Rams collide in a pivotal divisional showdown with major playoff implications on the line.
fullText:
Thursday delivers a slate built around one game that carries monumental weight in the NFL, as the Seahawks and Rams collide in a pivotal divisional showdown with major playoff implications on the line. While the spotlight shines brightest on the NFC West battle, the night also features a full menu of NHL action where matchups, trends and numbers create value across the board. Here are tonight‚Äôs best bets brought to you by BetOnline.ag. All new players get a 50% welcome bonus and up to $250 in free bets.

Rundown:¬†A pair of 11-3 teams collide on Thursday Night Football as the Los Angeles Rams travel to Seattle to face the Seahawks, with sole possession of first place in the NFC West on the line.

Tonight marks uncharted territory for the NFL. For the first time in league history, two teams with 11 or more wins meet on Thursday Night Football, as the Rams and Seahawks square off with the No. 1 seed hanging in the balance. Given the stakes, the matchup has a strong case as the most significant Thursday night game the league has ever seen.

According to FTN‚Äôs proprietary metric DVOA (defensive-adjusted value over average), these are two of the best teams ever through 14 games. The statistic has been tracked since 1978, with the 2007 Patriots ranking No. 1 all time after finishing the regular season a perfect 16-0.

History in the making üëÄ

Week 15 DVOA Ratings ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/T1Gel5KrfN pic.twitter.com/azJiozirlq

‚Äî FTN Fantasy (@FTNFantasy) December 17, 2025

Seattle and Los Angeles have been elite on both sides of the ball, each ranking inside the top five in scoring offense and scoring defense. Much of that success has been driven by two of the NFL‚Äôs premier wide receivers. Seattle‚Äôs Jaxon Smith-Njigba leads the league with 1,541 receiving yards on 96 catches, while Los Angeles has leaned heavily on third-year wideout Puka Nacua. The Rams will likely be without Davante Adams, however, as the future Hall of Famer is dealing with a hamstring injury suffered in Sunday‚Äôs win over Detroit.

Weather could also a noteworthy factor that affects the outcome. Rain is expected throughout the night in Seattle, conditions that often push offenses to lean on the ground game. Kyren Williams and Blake Corum headline the Rams‚Äô backfield, while Kenneth Walker and Zach Charbonnet carry the load for the Seahawks.

With first place at stake, key skill players potentially sidelined and slick field conditions in play, expect both defenses to prioritize limiting explosive plays and force long, methodical drives. A slower tempo paired with two elite defensive units points toward a tightly contested game that struggles to reach the projected point total.

Rundown:¬†The Los Angeles Kings (14-10-9) wrap up a three-game road trip as they visit the Tampa Bay Lightning (18-12-3) at Benchmark International Arena.

Entering tonight, both teams are looking to get back on track. Tampa Bay arrives after consecutive losses to the New York Islanders and Florida, while Los Angeles has dropped four straight. Defense has been a common strength, with both clubs ranking inside the top five in goals allowed. Tampa Bay sits fifth and Los Angeles second, with each allowing 2.6 goals per game. That combined average of 5.2 goals comes in slightly below tonight‚Äôs projected total.

Defense has not been the lone driver of Tampa Bay‚Äôs success this season. Through 33 games, the Lightning are averaging 3.2 goals per game, eighth-best in the NHL. Strong play at both ends of the ice has helped Tampa Bay post a plus-19 goal differential, which ranks fourth in the league.

Los Angeles, meanwhile, has leaned heavily on its defensive structure, but its offense has lagged behind. The Kings enter with the NHL‚Äôs 30th-ranked scoring offense and will need to find some consistency to keep the losing skid from growing. With two elite defensive units on the ice, expect scoring chances to be limited and the pace to stay controlled in a low-scoring matchup.

title: Arsenal defender is toughest to beat in the Premier League
description: Jurrien Timber is proving the toughest full-back to beat in the Premier League this season, according to new dribbling statistics.Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty ImagesOpta statistics released by OptaJoe ...
fullText:
Opta statistics released by OptaJoe this week reveal that Jurrien Timber has the lowest dribbled-past percentage for full-backs in the Premier League this season, based on a minimum of 30 true tackle attempts.

Timber has made 57 attempted tackles, with only five players getting past him, putting him at a 91% success rate.

The nearest player is Reinildo Mandava of Sunderland, who has been dribbled past four times from 38 attempts for an 89% success rate, followed by Michael Kayode (six from 46).

Riccardo Calafiori rounds out the top four, with only six of 45 dribble attempts against the Arsenal left-back proving successful.

The Gunners‚Äô starting full-backs both featuring in the top four in the league is likely a big factor in the club‚Äôs impressive defensive record this season.

Few would argue that Timber and Calafiori aren‚Äôt some of the best full-backs in the division, and the central defensive combination of Gabriel Magalhaes and William Saliba has been one of the best around for a long time now.

The concern at the moment is just around how often those four players will actually make it onto the pitch together.

Timber and Calafiori have both had serious injury issues with Arsenal in the past, and both have been dealing with knocks over the last fortnight. To make matters worse, Timber‚Äôs backups Ben White and Cristhian Mosquera are both injured, denying him rest opportunities.

Then Saliba has spent some time on the sidelines recently too, and Gabriel remains out of action with an Adductor injury.

If the quartet can all get fit and stay fit for the second half of the season, Arsenal will have a great chance at winning some trophies.

title: Jhostynxon Garcia Bids Red Sox Farewell With Emotional Instagram Post
description: It‚Äôs been two weeks since the Boston Red Sox traded former top prospect Jhostynxon Garcia to the Pittsburgh Pirates in a five-player deal. On Wednesday, Garcia bid the Red Sox farewell with an emotional Instagram post. The slideshow post featured seven pictures, one for each of Garcia‚Äôs stops with Boston‚Äôs organization. The Venezuela native joined [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
It‚Äôs been two weeks since the Boston Red Sox traded former top prospect Jhostynxon Garcia to the Pittsburgh Pirates in a five-player deal. On Wednesday, Garcia bid the Red Sox farewell with an emotional Instagram post.

The slideshow post featured seven pictures, one for each of Garcia‚Äôs stops with Boston‚Äôs organization. The Venezuela native joined the franchise in 2019 at age 16 and worked his way up to the Major Leagues, making his MLB debut in 2025.

Garcia, 23, also included a lengthy caption in both English and Spanish, thanking the Red Sox and their fans for their support.

Jhostynxon Garcia posting a seven-photo slideshow of himself at every level from the DSL to MLB with the Red Sox has me feeling emotional. A true player development success story. pic.twitter.com/VKm6GperO1

‚Äî Brendan Campbell (@brendan_camp) December 18, 2025

‚ÄúThank you to the Boston Red Sox organization and the fans for believing in me since I was a kid from Venezuela chasing a dream. Your support helped shape the player and the man I am today, and I‚Äôll always be grateful for the opportunity to wear that uniform,‚Äù Garcia wrote.

‚ÄúThe Password‚Äù also expressed excitement for the next phase of his career with the Pirates, where he‚Äôll look to establish himself as an everyday player after appearing in just five games for Boston last season.

‚ÄúNow it‚Äôs time for the next chapter,‚Äù Garcia continued. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited to join the Pittsburgh Pirates and get to work. New city, new colors, new goals ‚Äî and yes, a new password. I‚Äôm all in on helping bring a World Series back to Pittsburgh. Let‚Äôs get to work.‚Äù

While the Red Sox will miss Garcia, they are hoping Johan Oviedo and the two prospects they acquired in the deal can help them achieve their goals in 2026 and beyond.
